summary:
You know what confuses me the most?
Jon stabbed Daenerys. That was his way of ending it for her.
Jon Snow, who knew the pain of...
body:
You know what confuses me the most?

Jon stabbed Daenerys. That was his way of ending it for her.

Jon Snow, who knew the pain of being betrayed and murdered by those you trusted… and yet he went and did exactly that to the woman he was supposed to love?

Jon Snow, who knew the horror of dying by a stab wound and how much it terrified him, but yet he did exactly that to Daenerys anyway?

The characterisation this season was so wildly out of place that the writers decided that the best way for Daenerys to die was at the hands of Jon who had died a very similar way at the end of season 5, and didn’t even think back to the fact that they made him feel completely disgusted by the betrayal he received when he was murdered. The real Jon Snow would have NEVER done this to Daenerys, he would have never done this to anyone.

The more and more I think back over this season the more and more frustrated I get at the lack of respect for 7 seasons worth of character arcs all over the show being absolutely annihilated.

summary: I really want to know jons book storyline because i think he got so much mingled  with stannis and young griff (or the fact that...
question: I really want to know jons book storyline because i think he got so much mingled  with stannis and young griff (or the fact that his resurection was so unimportend they could have cut it too )that we do no know shit about it.
answer:
Jon’s adaption was definitely one of the poorer ones within the show, even early on. So much was missed in his portrayal: his temper, his passion, his joy, and just generally the sheer emotional capacity of his character. He cries out of anger and embarrassment in his very first chapter, later twirls Tyrion around in glee when he finds out Bran’s going to live, and convinces his fellow Night’s Watch recruits to help him protect Sam (threatening one with Ghost when he refuses). The show got some of the events right, but the feeling and character behind them are missing.

The other big issue came with the show’s basic plot: everything was so clumsily executed that it was basically impossible to showcase Jon’s intelligence and skill. Plot armor gets the credit for most of show!Jon’s triumphs, while in the books his journey has legitimate and meaningful obstacles. 

The final nail in the coffin was merging his storyline with Aegon/Young Griff’s; it’s one thing to mix the stories of two minor characters, or a minor one and a secondary one, but to do so with leading protagonists? Specifically when said protagonist and minor character are intentional and obvious foils? You get a completely different character. The Jon Snow of the show just isn’t recognizable as the Jon Snow of the books, and going off of that perception, it would be a safe guess to say that their storylines will differ just as drastically.

Show!Jon’s story was equal parts predictable and nonsensical, but at least there’s suspense in not knowing what exactly will happen for book!Jon.

tags: Jonerys was written as abusive and unbalanced
Whatever the feelings Jon and Sansa still chose each other
summary: Maybe jonerys coming as abusive & all that was wrong with it was because of bad writing/acting/editing etc & it was meant to be...
question: Maybe jonerys coming as abusive & all that was wrong with it was because of bad writing/acting/editing etc & it was meant to be taken as a love story indeed .Jonsa was meant to be one-sided as in unrequited romantic love from S to J coz that's what they showed onscreen. The purpose of parentage reveal was to drive J/D apart. That's it. I think this is what happened- they were aware of theories &  filmed scenes in S7 with pol jon in mind & making sure both J/S & J/D have their versions till the
answer:
(2) last ep where J/D will be confirmed. They did this to fool certain sections of fandom. Like a lot of foreshadowing of other things in the show that went nowhere. Because if it wasn’t the case, then they would have stopped with J/S in S8 & showed J/S as only siblings in S8 & showed struggle over j b/w S & D as only political. Instead they showed S in love with J even though it was never confirmed. J/D was to be like Jaime’s ( I knew what she was but loved her anyway) & Rhaegar/L impossible     

3- love that bought death/destruction in realm. In the books J will become blind to D’s faults too( but not like the show where he witnesses her being stopped from burning/ power hungry over saving people etc but other things that in his eyes will be ignorable) & choose his targ side especially after knowing his parentage. He’ll be conflicted but he’ll choose her & targ restoration coz that’s his house. Basically he’ll prove himself to be rhaegar’s son through & through. S is his Elia. Him       

4- saying I’m not a stark is meant to be taken as truth coz yes he’s a targ in actions & blood. By the end, J’s priorities have changed. He doesn’t want children coz the one with whom he wanted with is dead/turned out to be his aunt & he doesn’t want to be lord of winterfell coz he made his choice by choosing D/betrayed the north & can’t in any case coz he’s a targ who loves S only as a sibling. Basically his priorities have changed- he doesn’t want north/ wife & children by the end. S's 

5- priorities will change as well. She’ll be put in the same place as book1- b/w a man she’s in love with & family/north independence. This time she’ll chooses north wholeheartedly. Not just coz J doesn’t reciprocate her love & chose targ restoration, even if he loved her, she’ll still choose north. So S by the end will be married to her job/kingdom not coz she’s pining for J at the wall or is tired of waiting for love etc but coz that’s what she wants. Both J & S priorities would have changed       

6- changed by the end & they’re at peace with it. That’s what they want. Cat was right about J. He was rhaegar’s son through & through. Usurper of her children ending up at the wall dying childless. Finally if Jonsa was indeed the main lovestory then why didn’t D&D go with it? It would have perfect shock value they look for along with pol jon. GRRM told them J/D was it & they did it even though execution was wrong. No way they will make this up.            

Dear nonny,

you are of course entitled to your own opinion and this opinion seems to be that although Sansa might be in love with Jon, she chose the interest of the North, and that Jon was never in love with Sansa, but was in love with Dany, and that their love was doomed like Jaime/Cersei and Rhaegar/Lyanna. And this would mean that both Sansa and Jon are at the very least content with where they end.

As for Jonerys as a love story: We could probably argue about this until the world ends, but I just can’t see love, not from his side. And bad writing and lack of chemistry cannot account for everything. Jon looked miserable with her all the time and if he was in love with her, why did she not believe him in episode 5 and said “Let it be fear?”. This relationship was written as unbalanced and abusive. I just don’t see any love there, from both sides. He never showed love and she was infatuated. If she had loved him, she would not have tried to separate him from his family. I am sure we’ll get a Jonerys relationship in the books as well, and it might well be the “open” affair, that everybody knows about, but I don’t think it will be a love story that is in any way fulfilling and I suspect that it won’t be a love story in the books.

Everything up to the finale was ambiguous and open. I think they feared the backslash and made some last minute cuts. There are so many foreshadowings for Sansa continuing the line of Winterfell. And it all went nowhere, while other foreshadowings (like Arya going adventuring) were fulfilled. But there is possibly no way, I can convince you.

I would just say, that in the end, when it came down for Jon to choose between Sansa living or Dany living, he chose Sansa. You might interpret this in a sibling/dutiful way (although Jon’s constant reiteration of “My Queen” told us that Dany was his duty), but the fact remains. When it mattered, Jon identified as a Stark. He did not want to embrace his Targ side, when contemplating about his parenthood at the end of episode 2 we saw him in front of Lyanna’s statue not bent over a book with a picture of Rhaegar. If he would have embraced his Targ side, he would have ridden Rhaegal south. Sry, not sry. Jon does not embrace the Targ legacy. That does not rule out, that he loved Dany, at least not completely, because we are complicated human beings and our feelings can be conflicted. But ffs, why did they not spell this out? Why did we never see Jon’s conflicted feelings if it is that important? I interpret his guilt as having more to do with the fact that he killed Dany too late to save thousands of innocent lives, not that he killed her.

They deliberately left is ambiguous of course. But Political Jon and a last minute botch of the finale is the hill I’ll die on.

As for Sansa choosing the North: Did you not listen to what Sansa said:

- I wish Jon was here

- Jon will be so happy to see you

- Jon is our king

all said in season 7.

-  Did you bend the knee for the North or for love?

- I don’t want him [Jon] down there (meaning the South).  [even though it means, she can rule Winterfell as she wants]

- What if there was a better alternative?

- 10.000 Northmen will tell you that it is no good idea to threaten Jon Snow.

- But they lost their King (during the goodbye scene).

So, how can you say, that Sansa chose the North over Jon? She wanted Northern Independence, true enough, but she wanted Jon as the King in the North. She asked Jon for forgiveness, because she could not ensure the North for him. FOR HIM.

So, no, I beg to differ, nonny. Jon is not in love with Dany, he did not choose his Targ side. When it was crucial he chose Sansa and the Starks.

Sansa was/is in love with Jon. She wanted Jon in the North as King in the North. She fought for his kingship in season 7 and she fought for his return in season 8.

In conclusion, their priorities did not change. They wanted to save each other, and they wanted to help each other, and all they got was that they both are alive.

Still a shitty ending…

Thanks for the ask!

Dear nonny,

you are of course entitled to your own opinion and this opinion seems to be that although Sansa might be in love with Jon, she chose the interest of the North, and that Jon was never in love with Sansa, but was in love with Dany, and that their love was doomed like Jaime/Cersei and Rhaegar/Lyanna. And this would mean that both Sansa and Jon are at the very least content with where they end.

As for Jonerys as a love story: We could probably argue about this until the world ends, but I just can’t see love, not from his side. And bad writing and lack of chemistry cannot account for everything. Jon looked miserable with her all the time and if he was in love with her, why did she not believe him in episode 5 and said “Let it be fear?”. This relationship was written as unbalanced and abusive. I just don’t see any love there, from both sides. He never showed love and she was infatuated. If she had loved him, she would not have tried to separate him from his family. I am sure we’ll get a Jonerys relationship in the books as well, and it might well be the “open” affair, that everybody knows about, but I don’t think it will be a love story that is in any way fulfilling and I suspect that it won’t be a love story in the books.

Everything up to the finale was ambiguous and open. I think they feared the backslash and made some last minute cuts. There are so many foreshadowings for Sansa continuing the line of Winterfell. And it all went nowhere, while other foreshadowings (like Arya going adventuring) were fulfilled. But there is possibly no way, I can convince you.

I would just say, that in the end, when it came down for Jon to choose between Sansa living or Dany living, he chose Sansa. You might interpret this in a sibling/dutiful way (although Jon’s constant reiteration of “My Queen” told us that Dany was his duty), but the fact remains. When it mattered, Jon identified as a Stark. He did not want to embrace his Targ side, when contemplating about his parenthood at the end of episode 2 we saw him in front of Lyanna’s statue not bent over a book with a picture of Rhaegar. If he would have embraced his Targ side, he would have ridden Rhaegal south. Sry, not sry. Jon does not embrace the Targ legacy. That does not rule out, that he loved Dany, at least not completely, because we are complicated human beings and our feelings can be conflicted. But ffs, why did they not spell this out? Why did we never see Jon’s conflicted feelings if it is that important? I interpret his guilt as having more to do with the fact that he killed Dany too late to save thousands of innocent lives, not that he killed her.

They deliberately left is ambiguous of course. But Political Jon and a last minute botch of the finale is the hill I’ll die on.

- I wish Jon was here

- Jon will be so happy to see you

- Jon is our king

- I don’t want him [Jon] down there (meaning the South).  [even though it means, she can rule Winterfell as she wants]

Sansa was/is in love with Jon. She wanted Jon in the North as King in the North. She fought for his kingship in season 7 and she fought for his return in season 8.

In conclusion, their priorities did not change. They wanted to save each other, and they wanted to help each other, and all they got was that they both are alive.

Still a shitty ending…

summary: i was about to make a post making fun of jon and it didn’t feel right. that last episode really knocked out my dislike for him...
body:
i was about to make a post making fun of jon and it didn’t feel right. that last episode really knocked out my dislike for him and not because he changed my mind or i gained a new perspective on him. jon was so beaten down that saying anything bad about him feels… distasteful like kicking a dying man.

if you had told me this while season 6 aired, i wouldn’t have believed you

tags: How will Ramsay die in the books?
summary: How do you think ramsay will die in the books? Will sansa or jon kill him with his dogs in the books too? That sounds like a...
question: How do you think ramsay will die in the books? Will sansa or jon kill him with his dogs in the books too? That sounds like a major thing to change from the books, but I don't see book sansa doing that at least not yet, I don't know how much winds of winter will change her. Book jon sounds more plausible especially if he is his death made him more dark
answer:
Dear nonny,

I think I remember reading somewhere that D&D wanted Sansa to kill Ramsay (because bad-ass). I am quite certain, that Ramsay will be killed by his dogs in the books as well. He is the Hunter of Little Red Riding Hood, only in this version the hunter is the bad guy and the wolf - probably Jon/Ghost - is the hero. I’ve suspected that it will be more of an accident in the books (that is until I saw the finale) and the reason is this: GRRM makes quite a point about the Starks not killing or murdering easily, not without a trial at least. As much as I wanted Ramsay to die, Sansa deliberately feeding him to his dogs, never sat right with me tbh. It is not a ‘Stark’ thing to do and it does not fit Sansa’s character as she is at the end of AFFC.

Now, I am quite convinced that Sansa will have a narrow escape from Ramsay in the books. I hope GRRM spares her the Ramsay ordeal. We already saw how bad he is with Jeyne in the books, and I think that Sansa’s virginity as the method to get rid of her still-husband Tyrion will be of importance in the books.

I know, I would prefer Ramsay dying in poetic justice because of his own hubris, but my faith in GRRM has been severely shaken by the ending, so I must admit that I am not as certain as I was before. The killing of Ramsay by Jon or Sansa might serve to show them developing a vengeful side.

Thanks for the ask!

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: So I was having a conversation with my cousin, who is a huge ASoIaF fan (books only). We talked mainly about who we imagined as...
body:
So I was having a conversation with my cousin, who is a huge ASoIaF fan (books only). We talked mainly about who we imagined as the characters before the show came out. Here’s a summary of what we said:

1) My cousin pictured Jon Snow as young Christian Bale (like Newsies era). I pictured Jon as Prisoner of Azkaban-era Daniel Radcliffe.

2) I pictured Daenerys Targaryen as a younger version of the silver-haired girl from Ratt’s “Round and Round” music video. I was really into 1980s music in my high school years.

3) My cousin pictured Fat Bastard from the Austin Powers movies as Robert Baratheon, which I can’t unsee now.

4) Side note, because she mentioned Fat Bastard, she joked that young Robert was just regular Mike Myers.

5) My cousin pictured Karen Gillan as Catelyn Stark and the guy who played Benjen Stark as Ned Stark.

6) We both agreed Baby-era Justin Bieber was Joffrey Baratheon.

7) I personally thought Oberyn Martell was Antonio Banderas, specifically Zorro-era. My cousin thought he just looked like Inigo Montoya.

8) Robb Stark was a generic ginger guy for my cousin. I pictured Prisoner of Azkaban-era Rupert Grint.

9) My cousin pictured the Dothraki as the Mongols (so Khal Drogo was Genghis Khan). I pictured Drogo as Conan the Barbarian.

1) My cousin pictured Jon Snow as young Christian Bale (like Newsies era). I pictured Jon as Prisoner of Azkaban-era Daniel Radcliffe.

2) I pictured Daenerys Targaryen as a younger version of the silver-haired girl from Ratt’s “Round and Round” music video. I was really into 1980s music in my high school years.

3) My cousin pictured Fat Bastard from the Austin Powers movies as Robert Baratheon, which I can’t unsee now.

4) Side note, because she mentioned Fat Bastard, she joked that young Robert was just regular Mike Myers.

5) My cousin pictured Karen Gillan as Catelyn Stark and the guy who played Benjen Stark as Ned Stark.

6) We both agreed Baby-era Justin Bieber was Joffrey Baratheon.

7) I personally thought Oberyn Martell was Antonio Banderas, specifically Zorro-era. My cousin thought he just looked like Inigo Montoya.

8) Robb Stark was a generic ginger guy for my cousin. I pictured Prisoner of Azkaban-era Rupert Grint.

9) My cousin pictured the Dothraki as the Mongols (so Khal Drogo was Genghis Khan). I pictured Drogo as Conan the Barbarian.

title: just imagine if
body:
these characters had lived

Ygritte would have been take no nonsense queen in the north/queen consort I know she and Jon weren’t married but Id like to think that if she made it north of the wall to live with Jon in Winterfell that they would have married. Jon was an honourable man after all and he did love Ygritte and she would have gotten her pretty silk dress XD  

This one stemmed because I have seen a lot of fanart of khal drogo sitting on the iron throne even though he would only be king consort and wouldn’t actually sit on it but again I would have liked the idea of drogo getting to rule beside Dany he was better suited to her since she became a conquer they could have conquered together and maybe Dany wouldn’t have burnt down kings landing and just imagine if drogo got to ride a dragon I know Jon only got to ride one because he’s a targ but bearing in mind Dany actually encouraged Jon to ride Rhaegal not knowing about his heritage so maybe its just down to weather or not the dragons trust the people.

just a personal scenario I would have liked to have happened especially Ygritte being queen in the north or even the queen beyond the wall if game of thrones ended the same way or maybe it Robb and Talisa had lived Jon would have no reason to be king in the north and could just remain in the true north with the wildlings
